title: Breedon Group "solid" despite “flat” construction sector, Brexit uncertainty, cost pressures - Leicestershire Live
text:
Breedon Group "solid" despite “flat” construction sector, Brexit uncertainty, cost pressures Aggregate business says turnover for first 10 months of 2018 is up a third to £739m Share Get Business updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A “flat” UK construction market has failed to dampen the performance of Leicestershire aggregates giant Breedon Group , which has reported a “solid” first 10 months of the year.
The business, headquartered at Breedon on the Hill, near East Midlands Airport , said turnover for the period was up a third to around £739 million.
It also expects improved underlying earnings (before taxes and interest) of around £100 million and expects continuing strong cash generation – despite the construction sector slowing and rising input costs.
In a trading update Breedon said aggregate sales were up a fifth year-on-year while asphalt sales were up almost a half.
However the business said: “In common with the rest of the market our concrete volumes declined, by 5 per cent.
“Our cement business performed in line with our expectations.”
The business said forecasters expect UK construction output to be flat this year and to grow modestly next year before picking up pace in 2020.
Output in Northern Ireland is forecast to increase steadily over the same period, compared to the Republic of Ireland which is expected to deliver double-digit growth. Read More Multi-million pound deal between Leicestershire’s Breedon Group and Tarmac completed
Today’s update said: “Assuming normal weather conditions for the remainder of the financial year, the group's underlying EBIT (earnings before interest and taxes) for the full year is expected to be in line with current market expectations.
“We continue to commit substantial investment across our business, which brings us ongoing benefits in terms of enhanced performance and improved productivity. Read More Acquisitions help Breedon Group sales surge by a sixth in first half of 2018
“Whilst we are mindful of the likelihood of continuing cost pressures next year, coupled with the unpredictability of the outcome of the Brexit negotiations, we have consistently demonstrated our ability to deliver value for our shareholders, irrespective of market conditions.
“Accordingly, sustained organic improvement, continuing strong cash generation and our broadening geographical exposure, together with the potential for further bolt-on acquisitions, give us confidence that we will make further progress in 2019.” Like us on Facebook
